data.chText: 单独的；独立的；分开的
data.enText: forming a unit by itself; not joined to sth else

data.chText: 独立卧室
data.enText: separate bedrooms

data.chText: 生肉和熟肉必须分开存放。
data.enText: Raw meat must be kept separate from cooked meat.

data.chText: 学校设在两栋独立的楼房内。
data.enText: The school is housed in two separate buildings.

data.chText: 不同的；不相关的
data.enText: different; not connected

data.chText: 这事在三个不同的场合发生过。
data.enText: It happened on three separate occasions.

data.chText: 三年来，他们完全是各过各的生活。
data.enText: For the past three years they have been leading totally separate lives.

data.chText: 日本那种由来已久的自成一体、孑然独立的意识
data.enText: Japan's long-standing sense of separateness and uniqueness
go your separate ways

data.chText: 断绝往来；分道扬镳
data.enText: to end a relationship with sb

data.chText: 分路而行；分手
data.enText: to go in a different direction from sb you have been travelling with
under separate cover

data.chText: 另函
data.enText: in a separate envelope

data.chText: 现另函寄上所要资料。
data.enText: The information you requested is being forwarded to you under separate cover.

data.chText: （使）分开，分离；分割；划分
data.enText: to divide into different parts or groups; to divide things into different parts or groups

data.chText: 不停地搅动沙司，免得出现分层。
data.enText: Stir the sauce constantly so that it does not separate.

data.chText: 信仰和感情是分不开的。
data.enText: It is impossible to separate belief from emotion.

data.chText: 把蛋黄和蛋清分开。
data.enText: Separate the eggs (= separate the yolk from the white) .

data.chText: 列出各点，把它们分成“可取的”和“绝对必要的”两类。
data.enText: Make a list of points and separate them into ‘desirable’ and ‘essential’.

data.chText: （使）分离，分散
data.enText: to move apart; to make people or things move apart

data.chText: 我们分成几个搜索小组。
data.enText: We separated into several different search parties.

data.chText: 2亿年前南美洲和非洲分离。
data.enText: South America separated from Africa 200 million years ago.

data.chText: 南美洲和非洲于2亿年前分离。
data.enText: South America and Africa separated 200 million years ago.

data.chText: 警察力图把两个打架的人分开。
data.enText: Police tried to separate the two men who were fighting.

data.chText: 这场战争使许多家庭离散。
data.enText: The war separated many families.

data.chText: 传染病患者同其他病人隔离开来。
data.enText: Those suffering from infectious diseases were separated from the other patients.

data.chText: 隔开；阻隔
data.enText: to be between two people, areas, countries, etc. so that they are not touching or connected

data.chText: 两座城市相隔一千公里。
data.enText: A thousand kilometres separates the two cities.

data.chText: 我们的后院和运动场之间隔着一堵高墙。
data.enText: A high wall separated our back yard from the playing field.

data.chText: 分居
data.enText: to stop living together as a couple with your husband, wife or partner

data.chText: 他和妻子在结婚20年后分居了。
data.enText: He separated from his wife after 20 years of marriage.

data.chText: 他们于去年分居了。
data.enText: They separated last year.

data.chText: 区分；区别
data.enText: to make sb/sth different in some way from sb/sth else

data.chText: 我们之间唯一的分歧是政治观点。
data.enText: Politics is the only thing that separates us (= that we disagree about) .

data.chText: 裁判无法把两位参赛者分出高下。
data.enText: The judges found it impossible to separate the two contestants (= they gave them equal scores) .

data.chText: 领先的三队只相差四分。
data.enText: Only four points separate the top three teams.

data.id-g-sent: sort out/separate the men from the boys

data.enText: sort out/separate the sheep from the goats

data.chText: 区分能手与常人；分清智者和庸人
data.enText: to distinguish people who are good at sth, intelligent, etc. from those who are not
sort out/separate the wheat from the chaff

data.chText: 识别优劣；分清好坏；去芜存菁
data.enText: to distinguish useful or valuable people or things from ones that are not useful or have no value
separate out
separate sth↔out

data.chText: 使某物分开；划分
data.enText: to divide into different parts; to divide sth into different parts

data.chText: 区分出不同的意思
data.enText: to separate out different meanings

word_means: 可以不配套单独穿的妇女服装

means: 可以不配套单独穿的妇女服装

ex.chText: 请将批阅完的考卷按及格和不及格分开。
ex.enText: Please separate the marked examination papers into passes and fails.

ex.chText: 这两个社区被一条狭窄的街道隔开。
ex.enText: The two communities are separated by a narrow street.

ex.chText: 她把4个鸡蛋的蛋清和蛋黄分开。
ex.enText: She separated the whites and yolks of 4 eggs.

synonyms.bx: 指将混合物按不同类别分开，也指把紧连在一起或溶合在一起的东西分开。

ex.chText: 这条河把我的果园和他的果园隔开了。
ex.enText: The river divides my orchard from his.

ex.chText: 这个苹果被分成了4等份。
ex.enText: This cake is divided into four equal parts.

ex.chText: 老师把全班分成5个小组。
ex.enText: The teacher divided the class into five groups.

synonyms.bx: 指把两个区域分隔开，或将一个整体分为若干部分，有时含平均划分之意。

ex.chText: 把道德责任和政治责任分隔开来是错误的。
ex.enText: It is wrong to isolate moral responsibility from political responsibility.

ex.chText: 这个村子因洪水而与外界隔绝。
ex.enText: The village was isolated by the flood.

ex.chText: 传染病患者应予以隔离。
ex.enText: People with contagious diseases should be isolated.

ex.chText: 执政党内的激进派坚持主张从政治上孤立该国。
ex.enText: The radical group in the ruling party insisted upon isolating the country politically.

synonyms.bx: 指区别看待问题、观点等，也指使人或物处于孤立、隔离的状态。

ex.enText: She parts her hair in the middle.
The crowd parted to let the police car through.
She hated being parted from the children.
She has parted from her husband.

synonyms.bx: 多指使紧密相连的人或物分开，指父母和子女分开时多用被动语态。

data.enText: go your separate ways

data.chText: 断绝往来；分道扬镳
data.enText: to end a relationship with sb

data.chText: 分路而行；分手
data.enText: to go in a different direction from sb you have been travelling with
under separate cover

data.chText: 另函
data.enText: in a separate envelope

data.chText: 现另函寄上所要资料。
data.enText: The information you requested is being forwarded to you under separate cover.
separate/sort out the men from the boys

data.chText: 表明 / 证明谁有技能（或更勇敢等）
data.enText: to show or prove who is brave, skilful, etc. and who is not
sort out/separate the sheep from the goats

data.chText: 区分能手与常人；分清智者和庸人
data.enText: to distinguish people who are good at sth, intelligent, etc. from those who are not
sort out/separate the wheat from the chaff

data.chText: 识别优劣；分清好坏；去芜存菁
data.enText: to distinguish useful or valuable people or things from ones that are not useful or have no value
separate out
separate sth↔out

data.chText: 使某物分开；划分
data.enText: to divide into different parts; to divide sth into different parts

data.chText: 区分出不同的意思
data.enText: to separate out different meanings

tr: a garment that can be purchased separately and worn in combinations with other garments
a separately printed article that originally appeared in a larger publication
divide into two or more branches so as to form a fork
example: The road forks

tr: become separated into pieces or fragments
example: The figurine broke
The freshly baked loaf fell apart
We distinguish several kinds of maple

tr: arrange or order by classes or categories
example: How would you classify these pottery shards--are they prehistoric?
Separate the wheat from the chaff
He separated the fighting children
Moses parted the Red Sea
The two pieces that we had glued separated
The friends separated after the party
The business partners broke over a tax question
The couple separated after 25 years of marriage
My friend and I split up
divide the cake into three equal parts
The British carved up the Ottoman Empire after World War I

tr: treat differently on the basis of sex or race

example: The mountain range divides the two countries

tr: not attached to or supported by anything
example: a freestanding bell tower
a house with a separate garage

tr: separated according to race, sex, class, or religion
example: separate but equal
girls and boys in separate classes
a problem consisting of two separate issues
they went their separate ways
formed a separate church

value.boxr_value: The adjective and noun are pronounced /'sepərət/. The verb is pronounced /'sepəreɪt/. 形容词和名词读作 /'sepərət/。动词读作 /'sepəreɪt/。

value.def: If one thing is separate from another, there is a barrier, space, or division between them, so that they are clearly two things.

example.ex: Each villa has a separate sitting-room...
example.tran: 每栋别墅都有一间独立的起居室。

example.ex: They are now making plans to form their own separate party...
example.tran: 他们如今正计划组建自己的独立政党。

example.ex: Business bank accounts were kept separate from personal ones.
example.tran: 银行的商业账户和个人账户是分开管理的。

example.ex: ...establishing Australia's cultural separateness from Britain.
example.tran: 确立澳大利亚相对于英国的文化独立性

value.def: If you refer to separate things, you mean several different things, rather than just one thing.

example.ex: Use separate chopping boards for raw meats, cooked meats, vegetables and salads...
example.tran: 切生肉、熟肉、蔬菜和拌色拉的青菜时要使用不同的切菜板。

example.ex: Men and women have separate exercise rooms...
example.tran: 男女有各自的健身房。

example.ex: The authorities say six civilians have been killed in two separate attacks.
example.tran: 当局声称在两次不相关的袭击中已有 6 名平民丧生。

value.def: If you separate people or things that are together, or if they separate, they move apart.

example.ex: Police moved in to separate the two groups...
example.tran: 警方介入进来，将两拨人分开。

example.ex: The pans were held in both hands and swirled around to separate gold particles from the dirt...
example.tran: 双手握住淘选盘不停旋动将沙金和尘土分开。

example.ex: The front end of the car separated from the rest of the vehicle...
example.tran: 汽车的前端和车身分开了。

example.ex: They separated. Stephen returned to the square...
example.tran: 他们分开了。斯蒂芬返回了广场。

example.ex: They're separated from the adult inmates.
example.tran: 他们同成年犯分开关押。

value.def: If you separate people or things that have been connected, or if one separates from another, the connection between them is ended.

example.ex: They want to separate teaching from research...
example.tran: 他们想把教学和研究分开。

example.ex: It's  very possible that we may see a movement to separate the two parts of the country...
example.tran: 很可能我们会目睹一场分裂该国这两个地区的运动。

example.ex: He announced a new ministry to deal with Quebec's threat to separate from Canada.
example.tran: 他宣布成立一个新部门，专门处理魁北克威胁要从加拿大分裂出去一事。

value.def: If a couple who are married or living together separate, they decide to live apart.

example.ex: Her parents separated when she was very young...
example.tran: 她很小的时候父母就分居了。

example.ex: Since I separated from my husband I have gone a long way.
example.tran: 自从我和我丈夫分开后，我的生活发生了很大的变化。

value.def: An object, obstacle, distance, or period of time which separates two people, groups, or things exists between them.

example.ex: ...the white-railed fence that separated the yard from the paddock...
example.tran: 将院子和小围场隔开的白色围栏

example.ex: They had undoubtedly made progress in the six years that separated the two periods...
example.tran: 毫无疑问，他们在这两个时期相隔的 6 年间取得了进展。

example.ex: Rural communities are widely separated and often small...
example.tran: 乡村村落彼此离得很远，而且通常规模很小。

example.ex: But a group of six women and 23 children got separated from the others.
example.tran: 但是有一群人和其他人走散了，其中有 6 名妇人和23 个孩子。

value.def: If you separate one idea or fact from another, you clearly see or show the difference between them.

example.ex: It is difficult to separate legend from truth...
example.tran: 很难将传说和事实区别开来。

example.ex: ...learning how to separate real problems from imaginary illnesses...
example.tran: 学习如何分辨真实的和想象出的疾病

example.ex: It is difficult to separate the two aims.
example.tran: 很难将这两个目标区分开来。

example.ex: How can one ever separate out the act from the attitudes that surround it?
example.tran: 一个人的行为及与其息息相关的态度怎么能区分得开呢？

value.def: A quality or factor that separates one thing from another is the reason why the two things are different from each other.

example.ex: The single most important factor that separates ordinary photographs from good photographs is the lighting...
example.tran: 区分普通照片和出色照片的一个至关重要的因素就是光线。

example.ex: What separates terrorism from other acts of violence?
example.tran: 恐怖主义和其他暴力行为的区别是什么？

value.tran: 使得以区分;使获得区别

value.def: If a particular number of points separate two teams or competitors, one of them is winning or has won by that number of points.

example.ex: In the end only three points separated the two teams.
example.tran: 最终两队只相差 3 分。

value.tran: (两个参赛队或竞争者比分)相隔，相差

value.def: If you separate a group of people or things into smaller elements, or if a group separates, it is divided into smaller elements.

example.ex: The police wanted to separate them into smaller groups...
example.tran: 警察想把他们拆散成几小股。

example.ex: Wallerstein's work can be separated into three main component themes...
example.tran: 沃勒斯坦的作品可以细分成3个主要的主题。

example.ex: Let's separate into smaller groups...
example.tran: 我们分成几个小组吧。

example.ex: So all the colours that make up white light are sent in different directions and they separate.
example.tran: 这样构成白色光的所有颜色被投射到不同方向，从而分离开来。

example.ex: If prepared many hours ahead, the mixture may separate out.
example.tran: 如果提前几个小时就准备好了，混合物可能会分离开。

value.def: Separates are clothes such as skirts, trousers, and shirts which cover just the top half or the bottom half of your body.
When two or more people who have been together for some time go their separate ways, they go to different places or end their relationship.

example.ex: Sue and her husband decided to go their separate ways.
example.tran: 苏和丈夫决定离婚。

value.tran: 分道扬镳;分手;分路而行

xrse.def: to separate the wheat from the chaff

value.boxu_usage: Be careful with the spelling of this word.

trans: 与…分开；分开；分离；分离开来
分辨；区分；区别；分割；划分；拆散；分散；分离出；从…中拣出
分道扬镳；各路；各奔前程；各自为战
分流制；分流制排水系统；分离系统；分流制系统
独立法人；独立的法人；独立法定单位实体；独立法律主体；法律个体
不同的单元；分立单元；隔离块
单独实体；独立体；独立实体；一个独立的业务；分开的实体
人财产；独立财产；分别财产制；特有财产；独有财产
